info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rabun, southeastern Macon, southern Jackson and northwestern Oconee Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Clayton, or 7 miles southeast of Sky Valley, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oconee State Park, Pine Mountain, Mountain Rest, Bad Creek and Scaly Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern Georgia...western North Carolina...and Upstate South Carolina.
